item.title: Leetcode 1033: Moving Stones Until Consecutive
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

class Solution {
public:
    vector<int> numMovesStones(int a, int b, int c) {
        vector<int> s {a, b, c};
        sort(s.begin(), s.end());
        
        if(s[2]-s[0] == 2) return {0, 0};
        
        
        
        return {min(s[1]- s[0], s[2]-s[1]) <= 2? 1 : 2, s[2] - s[0] - 2 };
    }
};

Problem Statement Link to heading

In this problem, we are given three distinct integers representing the positions of three stones placed on a number line. The task is to determine how many moves are needed to position these stones such that they are aligned with each other. A “move” is defined as moving a stone from its current position to an adjacent empty position (i.e., moving it to either the left or the right).

item.title: Leetcode 1227: Airplane Seat Assignment Probability
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

class Solution {
public:
    double nthPersonGetsNthSeat(int n) {
        if(n == 1) return 1;
        return 1/2.0;
    }
};

Problem Statement Link to heading

The problem involves a scenario where there are ( n ) seats on a bus, and ( n ) passengers each have a ticket for a specific seat. The first passenger, however, does not have a preference and randomly chooses a seat upon boarding. Each subsequent passenger either takes their assigned seat if it is available or picks a random empty seat if it is taken.

item.title: Leetcode 1503: Last Moment Before All Ants Fall Out of a Plank
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

class Solution {
public:
    int getLastMoment(int n, vector<int>& left, vector<int>& right) {
        
        int mx = 0;
        for(int i = 0; i < right.size(); i++)
            mx = max(mx, n - right[i]);
        
        for(int i = 0; i < left.size(); i++)
            mx = max(mx, left[i]);        
        
        return mx;
    }
};

Problem Statement Link to heading

The problem at hand requires us to determine the last moment a set of ants will remain on a stick of length n. The ants can either be moving to the left or to the right, and we need to find out when the last ant falls off the stick.

item.title: Leetcode 2419: Longest Subarray With Maximum Bitwise AND
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

class Solution {
public:
    int longestSubarray(vector<int>& nums) {
        int x = *max_element(nums.begin(), nums.end());
        int len = 0, ans = 0;
        for(int ele: nums) {
            if(ele == x) {
                ans = max(ans, ++len);
            } else len = 0;
        }
        return ans;
    }
};
LeetCode Exercise Compilation / Next : LeetCode #2420: Find All Good Indices

item.title: Leetcode 2425: Bitwise XOR of All Pairings
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

class Solution {
public:
    int xorAllNums(vector<int>& nums1, vector<int>& nums2) {
        int m = nums1.size(), n = nums2.size();
        
        int xr1 = nums1[0], xr2 = nums2[0];
        
        for(int i = 1; i < m; i++)
            xr1 ^= nums1[i];
        
        for(int i = 1; i < n; i++)
            xr2 ^= nums2[i];

        if((n % 2) == 0) {
            if((m % 2) == 0) {
                return 0;
            } else {
                return xr2;
            }
        } else {
            if((m % 2) == 0) {
                return xr1;
            } else {
                return xr1 ^ xr2;
            }            
        }
        return -1;
    }
};
LeetCode Exercise Compilation / Next : LeetCode #2426: Number of Pairs Satisfying Inequality

item.title: Leetcode 2568: Minimum Impossible OR
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

class Solution {
public:
    int minImpossibleOR(vector<int>& nums) {
        set<int> cnt;
        int n = nums.size();
        for(int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
            cnt.insert(nums[i]);
        }
        int ret = 1;
        while(cnt.count(ret)) {
            ret *= 2;
        }
        // to create all the numbers till a positive integer
        // presents of all the powers of 2s below it are mandatory.
        return ret;
    }
};
LeetCode Exercise Compilation / Next : LeetCode #2569: Handling Sum Queries After Update

item.title: Leetcode 2731: Movement of Robots
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

class Solution {
public:
    int sumDistance(vector<int>& nums, string s, int d) {
        for(int i = 0; i < nums.size(); i++) {
            if(s[i] == 'L') nums[i] -= d;
            else nums[i] += d;
        }
        sort(nums.begin(), nums.end());
        int n = nums.size();
        long long ans = 0, dist = 0, mod = (int) 1e9 + 7;
        for(int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
            dist += ((long)nums[i] - nums[i - 1]) * (i);
            ans = (ans + dist) % mod;
        }
        return ans;
    }
};
LeetCode Exercise Compilation / Next : LeetCode #2732: Find a Good Subset of the Matrix

item.title: Leetcode 319: Bulb Switcher
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

class Solution {
public:
    int bulbSwitch(int n) {
        return sqrt(n);
    }
};

Problem Statement Link to heading

You have n bulbs, initially turned off. A person toggles the state of the bulbs (turning them on if they are off and vice versa) in the following manner:

  • On the first round, they toggle every bulb.
  • On the second round, they toggle every second bulb.
  • On the third round, they toggle every third bulb, and so on until the n-th round.

The goal is to determine how many bulbs are on after n rounds.

item.title: Leetcode 810: Chalkboard XOR Game
item.description:
Problem Link

Code:

class Solution {
public:
    bool xorGame(vector<int>& nums) {
        int net = 0;
        for(int x: nums)
            net ^= x;
        return net == 0 || nums.size() % 2 == 0;
    }
};

Problem Statement Link to heading

In a game with an array of integers, two players take turns to choose an integer and remove it from the array. The player who is unable to make a move (because the array is empty) loses. The goal is to determine if the first player can guarantee a win given the initial array.
